body_html:
A few notes first:

  • libpthread.so itself is not the problem, just a symptom here, as it seems you have a general issue with your bazel install
  • There's currently a Bazel/NDK 11 incompatibility, so you should be using r10e
  • Bazel 0.2.0 or 0.2.1 should work, and "which bazel" should tell you /usr/bin/bazel after install

You said before that:
/home/administrator/.cache/bazel/_bazel_administrator/d80406fadc9e2685aed9bed686923250/tensorflow/bazel-out/android-arm-linux-androideabi-4.9-v7a-gnu-libstdcpp-fastbuild/bin/tensorflow/examples/android/libtensorflow_demo.so
"wasn't there". So that means the link exists (since you provided the "find" output that showed it), but the target of the link doesn't? Can you check your current set of links produced by bazel in the [workspace]/bazel-* folder, and see if they point to nothing as well?

How much free disk space/memory do you have?

body:
A few notes first:
- libpthread.so itself is not the problem, just a symptom here, as it seems you have a general issue with your bazel install
- There's currently a Bazel/NDK 11 incompatibility, so you should be using r10e
- Bazel 0.2.0 or 0.2.1 should work, and "which bazel" should tell you /usr/bin/bazel after install

You said before that:
`/home/administrator/.cache/bazel/_bazel_administrator/d80406fadc9e2685aed9bed686923250/tensorflow/bazel-out/android-arm-linux-androideabi-4.9-v7a-gnu-libstdcpp-fastbuild/bin/tensorflow/examples/android/libtensorflow_demo.so`
"wasn't there". So that means the link exists (since you provided the "find" output that showed it), but the target of the link doesn't? Can you check your current set of links produced by bazel in the [workspace]/bazel-\* folder, and see if they point to nothing as well?

How much free disk space/memory do you have?
